I saw them live last year which was marvelous and unforgettable. The group and the dancers and acrobats which they invited gave a magnificent performance. The choreography, lighting, glow sticks and stage design were superb. It exceeded expectations. Yesterday I assigned five and a half hours for practicing their songs on my trumpet, cornet, trombone, euphonium, french horn and tuba. I practised with my friends who play chimes, celesta, timpani, glockenspiel, marimba, xylophone and vibraphone, all of which have definite pitch. Adding these instruments makes the music more rhythmic. Clarinet and saxophone ate single-reed instruments whereas oboe, cor anglais and bassoon are double-reed. Flute is reedless. Cor anglais (english horn), saxophone and clarinet are transposing instruments.
